list_definition.definition: to prepare (a book, manuscript, newspaper, programme/program, film etc) for publication, or for broadcasting etc, especially by correcting, altering, shortening etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He spent six months editing the film.

list_ex_of_english: The main text was not rewritten or edited, and no new literature was incorporated into the discussion.
The book is well written, illustrated and edited and is packed with valuable information for researchers, growers and consumers.
Readers will remember that a collection with the same title, edited by the same two editors, appeared in 1980.
All of the published papers have been peer-reviewed and rigorously edited.
Each piece of writing is meticulously edited, and provided with a useful but unobtrusive commentary.
The book is edited, for example, at a moment of economic and political crisis.
The transcript was extensively revised by the composer and edited by the present writer to produce the current version.
All the essays are worthwhile and well edited.
